column7: Limited in general to seniors in biochemistry. BIOC 492 is recommended for all those who plan to do research and graduate study, and it is a prerequisite for graduation with distinction in biochemistry. Each student who desires to do thesis research must receive written permission from a member of the biochemistry faculty. Accordingly, prospective students are encouraged to contact the biochemistry staff in the term prior to registration in this course. Students must present a thesis to receive credit in this course. 1 to 6 undergraduate hours. No graduate credit. May be repeated; enrollment is limited to three semesters. Prerequisite: MCB 354 and BIOC 455, or consent of instructor.
